result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberto R. Soto

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order

9:59 AM Defendant Roberto R. Soto in court.  Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Roberto R. Soto.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:08 PM
Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Xavier Solis for Phil Marry. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Preliminary Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am. Bond continued as previously set. ec
Adjourned initial appearance on October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:16 PM
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person. Clerk JT  Minutes: Def will retain his own counsel. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm. atty status. Bond continued as previously posted. DE waives time for the preliminary hearing. ec
due to illness DE reschedules AIA from 08-30 to 09-13-22 at 1pm Intake.  DA notified.
Clerk attempted to call back DE re: possibly rescheduling no answer left v/m.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

225PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Atty Status.  Bond continued as previously set.  DE waives time for the preliminary hearing.   ts
from the court regarding rotation sent to DE
Adjourned initial appearance on July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:37 - 03:39 PM  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State under the supervision of Attorney Burgoyne.   Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk PU. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm..  Bond continued as previously set. (see previous bond entry). DE previously given advocate counsel paperwork. DE was involved in an accident and has not yet completed the paperwork. rb
Adjourned initial appearance on June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:40 PM  Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Bond continued w/same conditions  DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Deft is going to attempt advocate counsel or retain private counsel.  kmk
Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Roberto R. Soto, appeared.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE not eligible for SPD and is given advocate counsel paperwork today.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Not Eligible for SPD Services

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia

01:51 PM  
  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kelly Leibhan.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 3/16/22 @ 900am.  $2000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).    jk
and witness list filed by the State
